subtitle: [Music]
Thinking Allowed.
Conversations on the leading edge of
knowledge and discovery
with psychologist Jeffrey Mishlove.
Hello and welcome. I'm Jeffrey Mishlove.
Once again
I'm going to be having a conversation
with
myself. That's me. Today we're going
to explore
two of the biggest mysteries confronting
the human race today. We're going to look
and see if they aren't related to each other.
I'm talking about the mystery associated
with aliens and UFOs and the mystery
associated with life after death, the
afterlife. So the
topic is titled, aliens in
the afterlife. There's good reason to
think that these
topics overlap. I know a lot of it
has to do with some of your earliest
research with the PK Man, Ted Owens.
That's right. Thank you for bringing it
up. Now, I know
many of our viewers have actually read
The PK Man and I've done, I don't know,
half a dozen or more
interviews about it out of the thousand
or so that are on the New Thinking Allowed
channel. But let me summarize. I did a
10 year field study with a man named Ted
Owens who
explained himself to me as a UFO
abductee-contactee, a person whose brain
had been operated on by aliens
to give him enormous power, power greater
than any human has ever exercised
since the days of Moses. He explained
that... He didn't just explain,
no, he demonstrated. I have in my files 160
examples of these demonstrations. About
100 of them I would say or more pretty
much worked out the way he
said they would. He showed large-scale
psychokinetic effects which he claimed
were mediated because of his
telepathic communication with what he
called the Space
Intelligences. We're talking about
hurricanes, tornadoes, earthquakes,
large-scale
power blackouts, droughts, ending droughts
typically, not causing them. But if he got angry at
people there could be
waves of lightning strikes. Lightning was
another one of his specialties. Now, this
all has a lot to do with alien
intelligences. In fact, UFO sightings
are part of the signatures that
accompany his demonstrations.
I've talked about this a great deal on
New Thinking Allowed in the past. I'm not going to
repeat it now. What I want to talk about
is the relationship between the Space
Intelligences and
the afterlife. It has to do with Ted
Owens’ death.
He died in 1987
living in a small town in upstate New
York, Fort Ann.
Before he died he wrote to me and explained
that the Space Intelligences wanted him
to move to Fort Ann for some reason. Well,
there's been a lot of UFO activity in
upstate New York. Whitley Strieber, who
I'll be talking about
for example, had his
major encounters in that area. Before he
died Owens wrote to me and indicated
that there were alien
ships and strange lights hovering right
over the farmhouse
where he was living. And in fact, there
were articles in the local newspaper
about it and a letter of testimonial
from his
neighbor saying, yeah, he saw these lights
directly over Owen's
farmhouse. Owen said, “Yes, they've come to
merge with me.”
And within a few weeks he died.
So that was a hint to me that there's
some relationship. Now, there's a big
mythology of course relating UFOs to the
afterlife. There was the
incident of the Bo and Peep [Heaven’s Gate]
I know there's another name for it. But
when the comet Kohoutek [Hale-Bopp]
came along there were mass
suicides by people
who were under the misguided impression,
I think,
that a UFO was trailing along behind the
comet and it was going to pick them up.
They committed suicide so they could meet the UFO. Well,
what that tells us is
that there is some overlap between
authentic spiritual communication — and I
have to put it bluntly, delusion, I would
never ever recommend people commit
suicide. The expectation that they'll
be picked up
by aliens in a UFO, and of course there were no
UFOs accompanying the Kohoutek [Hale-Bopp] comet
unless they were
of the type that Ted Owens talked about,
invisible ones.
But that I don't think is what they
thought. At the time there was I think a
photograph that had been published
that implied erroneously that there was
some sort of UFO
hanging out with this comet.
But that delusion
aside, there are other examples.
Well, let's get into the other examples.
This is beginning to be
quite interesting. Let me talk for
example about a
recent interview that was released on
the New Thinking Allowed channel probably
a week before I release this one,
with Robin Foy. If you haven't watched
that I am going to link to it right now.
You can click on it, it's fascinating.
Robin Foy
is the
founder of the Scole Group
and the founder of the Noah's Ark
Society, two organizations that
brilliantly pioneered the use of
physical mediumship to produce effects
that astonished
researchers from the Society for
Psychical
Research. But in this interview
he talks about, and it's near the beginning,
he talks about
an example of a physical medium in
2007 who came to visit him
where he's now living in Spain and
materialized the whole
crew of spirit guides who are working
with his team. And of course, these spirit
guides are
essentially discarnate humans. But he
said amongst them
was an alien, an extraterrestrial
who has been working with them as a
spirit guide
since the days of the Scole Group, which
is some 25
years ago. So,
there is another connection. There you
have an
alien in the midst of a group of
discarnates. Now,
Whitley Strieber in his book
Communion, reports this amazing incident
in which
he's having sex with an alien, a
visitor, an extraterrestrial with the big
almond eyes, and he reports that in the
same
room with him there were people watching
them having sex.
One of them was a person he knew had
died.
So now you have a discarnate amongst the
aliens. So, there seems to be a lot of
overlap. Fascinating. Do you have another
example?
Indeed I do. Now, a few weeks before
this video has been released I also released
a fascinating study, really fascinating
study, an interview with Roy
Stemman, who worked for decades with
George Chapman, a medium and a healer
who manifested the persona,
or one might say the spirit, of Dr.
William Lang for a period of six
decades. Now, the interesting thing here
is that Dr. Lang, in the book
that Chapman wrote with Roy Stemman, it's
called Surgeon from Another World,
meaning the afterlife, but he talks
about his communication with a scientist
in England named John Best. John Best
has written a book. I'm going to post the
book cover now. I think it's called
Links and Communique.
In it John Best talks about his many
encounters with
William Lang through the mediumship
of George Chapman.
But he also talks about his deceased
fiancee,
Marjorie. That's mostly what the book is
about. Marjorie is communicating to
him, he's
receiving regular messages, evidential
messages from her in the afterlife.
She's describing
her experiences in the afterlife. She was
a nurse as I recall
in her physical existence. In the
afterlife
she has the job of visiting
various hospitals and situations that a
nurse is called for
and they've given her a vehicle. The
vehicle that he
describes is very much like what you'd
think of as a flying saucer.
It can travel thousands of miles an hour
on the planet, and even faster if she
goes off planet. So, here
we have what could be a credible
instance of a UFO being piloted within
the afterlife. I could go on
and on about this because the
implications
are really quite astonishing. Well of
course, you have to ask yourself, how much
of this is fantasy?
How much of this is folklore? How much of
it is actual based on reality? I mean,
let's face it, we live in a world in
which the mainstream is... I think
at this point, because of the articles
written in The New York Times by
people who we've recently interviewed,
like Ralph Blumenthal and Leslie Kean,
people understand UFOs are real. They've
been tracked on radar by the US
Navy. I think it's fair to say the US
government has known about them for
maybe 70 years or more. But
still, there's an enormous
amount of imagination that goes into all
of this.
Think of the many science fiction books
that have been written.
Think of the work of Carl Jung himself.
His book, Flying Saucers, in which he
suggests that
the manifestation of flying saucers in our culture, which really
began in 1947 in the modern era — of course, you can
trace it back to biblical times —
but in recent years Jung described
it as the birth of a new
religion. How do you sort through all of
this?
Well, the study of the afterlife also
extensively
implicates religion. After all,
practically every religion has some
belief in the afterlife. What religions
don't generally subscribe to his
scientific investigation of it
because they prefer the
approach based on revelation and
dogmatism.
Nevertheless, the
possibility of conducting scientific
research and
both UFOlogy and
the question of postmortem survival
has been going on slowly low-key
decade after decade. We are able to
sort through the morass
of fantasy, religious dogma,
and to be honest, delusion, mental
illness.
All of these things are inter-penetrated
with some sort of
real phenomena going on. In fact, I think
you have some statistics
in that regard. Well, of course.
Once again I'm going to link to an
interview
with Ray Hernandez and another one with
Joseph Burkes,
if I have the name correct. These are
people who have conducted
survey research of UFO
experiencers, alien experiencers. What
they find is a
very high percentage of people who
claim to have been abducted, who have
had face-to-face conversations while
wide awake
with aliens also report a high degree,
very high percentage, I think 37 percent
of them, have had near-death experiences which is way above the
general population. I think maybe 80
percent of them have had out-of-body
experiences. So it seems to me,
from my perspective, I can tell you this.
The evidence for life after death, for
the afterlife, is
overwhelming. That's why I've been doing
so many of these monologues and
interviews on that topic. I'll be
revealing more and more
about that. The evidence for something
authentic going on in the UFO world
is overwhelming. Now, if
the aliens are, let us say, from another
dimension or another planet, if they are
as they often seem to be biological
creatures
with bodies very different than our own,
they live and they die, they are mortal
beings just as we are.
As such, assuming that they're conscious
like we are, that they share the one mind
that sees through the eyes of all creatures,
as we do, then
being likely more advanced
spiritually, emotionally, technologically
than we are,
perhaps, they know a great deal about the
afterlife. Maybe travel back and forth between
their physical world and the afterlife
is what we will have,
let's say two-three hundred years from
now. The great project of psychonauts,
which I will have to talk about,
psychonautics. People today are
exploring the afterlife in
many different ways. Let me butt in
here. Let me
list some of the ways. We've done videos
already on meditation-induced near-death
experience. And of course there are
spontaneous
near-death experiences that people have.
There's the use of entheogens and drugs for
exploring the bardo planes.
There's people who enter into these
altered states of supersensible
realities through hypnosis. There are people who can consciously
engage in lucid dreaming and
out-of-body travel. All of these things
are, these people are the pioneers.
They're exploring the
afterlife or the super sensible realms, and there are many of them, probably well
beyond what we call the
afterlife. And they're doing it
consciously.
We are at a point in history, in my
opinion,
where we can begin to apply
greater and greater scientific rigor
to these explorations.
We have for example, the mathematics of
hyperspace.
We can begin to explore these super
sensible realms
much in the way people five-six-seven
hundred years ago
explored the new continents of North and
South America.
We'll find of course that these realms
are already inhabited.
We're not about to colonize them
but we can begin to expand
our own horizons once again, the way
people did
when the new world was discovered. Only
the new world this time
will be within us. I suppose it's useful
to also point out that
in traditional
religious iconography
many creatures, demonic
creatures often, although they were
sometimes viewed very positively
as guardian spirits and daemons and the
like,
inhabited these super sensible realms.
The funny thing is if you look at
some of the
illustrations they sort of resemble
sometimes the
illustrations that we get today of alien
beings.
The reptilians are kind of diabolic.
Arthur Clarke, in his great novel
Childhood’s
End suggested just as much, when he has
the aliens visit the earth and reveal
themselves,
they look like the devil. So
there may be a connection
between
aliens, angels, archetypes and the
afterlife.
Well, I know there's so much more to say
about this and I know over time
we will have much more to say about it.
But for now
I want to thank you for being with me yet again. We have delightful conversations
with each other.
And for those of you watching or
listening, thank you
for being with us. Thank you.
[Music]
